message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.MM

This paper deals with computer vision and machine learning techniques for finding occlusion boundaries in videos. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also uses a random forest for learning pair wise occlusion probabilities, which falls under the category of machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of Markov random fields (MRF) for enforcing occlusion boundary continuity also suggests the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also deals with the semantic layout of the scene, which is related to robotics and automation (cs.RO). Finally, the paper uses appearance and flow features, which are commonly used in multimedia processing (cs.MM).
